PreparerFirmName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: C DeWitt Foard & Co PA CPAs

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To provide affordable housing to low income families with interest free mortgages.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To provide affordable housing to low income families with interest free mortgages.
IRS990.Desc: During the year 45 low income families were served through construction services that included 4 new homes, 2 recycled homes, 29 urgent repair projects and 10 families in transitional housing. Further, maintained interest free mortgages and provided homeowner services to over 104 homeowners.ReStore sales result from donated merchandise contributed by businesses and individuals interested in Habitat's mission. These expenses represent the cost of producing this revenue. The profits from this activity were used to subsidize construction and operating costs during the year.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XI, Line 2d: Other revenue amounts included in F/S but not included on form 990
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Cost of goods sold reported gross $571904 Special event expenses reported at net $22566

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Cost of goods sold reported gross $571904 Special event expenses reported at net $22566

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: Provide affordable housing in the Dominican Republic

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Each board member will receive a copy of the organization's Form 990 to review before the form is filed with the IRS. Any questions, comments or changes will be addressed before the tax return is filed.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Habitat enforces conflict of interest policy by competitive bidding and/or involved persons excused from discussions and votes.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A 3rd party was used to establish the current compensation program in 2010. That effort utilized four independent sources of wage and salary analysis data. Since then, a basic review of comparative data is performed annually with a more in-depth analysis for all positions occurring every three years. The entire Board votes on pay increases to be received by the Executive Director and other employees annually.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
